alert.note: Alert for White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 09 at 1:33PM MST until December 12 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 5000 feet. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches will be possible, with locally higher amounts between 12 and 16 inches near the Sunrise Ski Resort in the White Mountains. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 5000 feet near Alpine, Pinetop-Lakeside, Show Low, and Whiteriver. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Snow forecast from 5 AM Monday to 11 PM Monday: Alpine 3 to 5 inches Pinetop-Lkside 4 to 8 inches Show Low 4 to 6 inches Whiteriver 3 to 5 inches.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
